intro: Escallonia humilis, commonly known as the low bush escallonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for use as a hedging plant or in rock gardens. Escallonia humilis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
